about_the_game:
How to play "LogicBlock"

This is a Mondrian art style puzzle game.

This is a puzzle game where players use blocks as game elements to piece together scattered blocks.

catalogue

You can play 3000 puzzles, from low to high difficulty.

First, you start playing simple puzzles and try a little harder.

From simple to difficult, you can play in over 3000 ways.

The game may seem simple, but it requires complex logical thinking and is suitable for experienced players. You must solve puzzles without any reference images.

The simple and intuitive gameplay is very suitable for players of all ages and skill levels.

These puzzles are challenging, and solving them will give people a sense of achievement.

Languages

LogicBlock can be translated into 17 languages; Japanese, English (United States), Korean, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, German, French, Italian, Spanish (Spanish), Arabic, Hindi, Bengali, Tamil, Indonesian, Russian, Portuguese (Brazil), and Polish.

If you are willing, you can choose the puzzle name and the language of the message from the options.

Creator's comments

We created 'LogicBlock' because we wanted to play a puzzle game that could create pixel art.

We enjoy the feeling of being together and the sense of achievement when solving problems.

We hope you enjoy playing 'LogicBlock' as much as we enjoy creating it!

short_description: Logic Grid is a puzzle game with a seemingly simple design, but in reality, it is very difficult. The operation is simple. Drag and drop the bottom blocks onto the chessboard to piece together a large square to complete the level. Even though it is so simple, it requires deep thinking and logic.
